file_content.text: Jedi? It's Klage. I've been monitoring the Hutt Cartel's defense network.
That operation was smooth. The factories never saw it coming. You've got a real talent.
I wish to give nothing but my best efforts to the Guiding Hand.
I take pride in my work.
No kidding. You definitely earned this, then.
I just took my time.
Patience, huh? I'll remember that. In the meantime, you got a special treat.
Now do you believe that I'm as good as Tharan Cedrax?
Rivaling Tharan, maybe?
Absolutely. Forget Cedrax, I should have gone after you in the first place.
What? Ignore him, Jedi. He clearly has bantha fluff between his ears.
Protocols are down. Those factories are ripping themselves apart. Great work.
How many died in those factories because of me and the Guiding Hand?
This was wrong.
We all got tough decisions to make. But you're not going unrewarded.
Only doing my job.
Smile, Jedi. All that tough work didn't go unnoticed.
Any other Hutt Cartel targets in need of some special attention?
Need anything else?
Whoa, whoa, slow down! Don't you want your big reward?
The Master himself has heard about you. He wants you to be presented to him. In person.
Just give me his location and I'll be right there.
Where?
The Master wants to meet me? I hope I'm worthy.
What an honor.
The Master realizes he has a powerful new ally.
Finally.
The Master's waiting at our headquarters in the Red Light Sector. It's in an old store--here, I'll upload it to your map.
Don't be long. Our fight against the Hutt Cartel is heating up, and the Master doesn't like delays.
Where's Tharan Cedrax? The darkness is coming. The Lancers need the man who solved the M'raki Uplink Paradox, not some unplugged Jedi.
At least he can appreciate good work.
Forget this. I have to get Tharan Cedrax for the job. Master's orders.
He couldn't come. I brought my latest creation to show I'm worthy.
Tharan sent me instead.
I'm as good as Cedrax at half the price. Here's an example of my work.
I'm a better recruit.
You could spend days chasing Cedrax... or hire me now, and give my newest weapon to your Master.
So you don't want this weapon?
Hmm. Impressive. But the Master said, "Get Cedrax." Even a Jedi's no good--bet you don't even know what a D3-TR port is.
A D3-TR port is used to fix computer spikes. Basic stuff, he's playing with you.
They repair computer spikes, of course.
D3 is for fixing spikes.
All right. But that was a gimme.
I came here in good faith, not to have my intelligence slighted.
Don't insult me.
Okay, sorry, don't bust a gimbal.
My specialty is technology that stops my enemies.
I prefer to focus on weaponry.
Good point. That's what the best tech is all about.
So if you were going to slice Nar Shaddaa's traffic control towers, what channel would you cut?
Any channel, I suppose. Apart from 552. Too risky.
With the traffic control towers, it doesn't really matter. I'd stay off 552, though.
Any channel.
True enough. Pays to be focused.
Five fifty-two is the only channel that would present a real challenge.
552. I'm that good.
Seriously? Impressive. None of my people can crack Cartel security.
There's no profit in knowing who's taking a trip to Coruscant today.
I wouldn't bother.
Unless you're selling that data to a kidnapper.
And this weapon of yours: What's the power source?
It's exo-technology, nothing he'd understand. Tell him what you like.
Something I salvaged from a discarded droid.
Just an old battery.
You got a salvaged part to run this? Nice work.
It's rare technology from outside the galaxy.
It's exo-technology.
Uh-huh. Really. Not like I can strip it to take a look, I suppose.
I'd explain it for you, but I don't have that much time to spare.
It's over your head.
Fine. You want to guard your secrets, I can understand that.
You're not Cedrax, but if you can build weapons like this, you're definitely Lancer material.
In the name of the Master, the Red Light Lancers and the Guiding Hand welcome you, sister.
Welcome to the Red Light Lancers and the Guiding Hand, brother. Serve the Master well.
I've heard a lot about your Master. I'm anxious to pay my respects.
When can I meet the Master?
Sorry. No fresh recruits see the Master, however good they are.
So, how can a Jedi help the Lancers and the Guiding Hand?
I want to help you, brother.
All right, I'm welcomed. What happens now?
Let's hurry this up.
The Master wanted Tharan Cedrax for a special job. It'll do for your initiation test, if you live.
The Hutt Cartel shares a bunch of spice factories with the Empire, in the lower industrial sector. The Master wants them destroyed.
If all your Lancers couldn't do this, sending one person seems... odd.
Just me? Why not the gang?
Ah, but you got unique skills.
Destroying entire factories is a tall order, even for my skills.
Could be tricky.
We got it worked out.
I'm not afraid of risky work.
Go to the defense network control room, and disrupt the protocols on the primary control node. That'll trigger the factories' automated defenses.
Turrets, droids, poison gas--the factories and their workers will be wiped out. The Hutt Cartel will see what the Guiding Hand can do!
I signed on to oppose the Hutt Cartel, not kill innocent factory workers.
That's murder. I won't do it.
If you're not devoted to the cause, might as well turn around now.
I guess it's necessary.
The Hutt Cartel's an agent of the darkness. We have to stop them.
I'd hoped Nar Shaddaa would bring a true challenge.
Let's get to it.
Heh. We should have recruited you sooner.
I'll be monitoring the Cartel's defense network, so I'll know exactly when the job is done. Don't keep us waiting.
That's a tricky proposition, Jedi. Meet me at my offices. I'll get started on a way to help you.
